DOC.brief_title: Use On-Q Pump Pain Post C-Section
DOC.detailed_description: The main purpose study examine pain level treat intrathecal ( IT ) preservative-free morphine ( PFM ) cesarean section improve additional use continuous subfascial wound infiltration ropivacaine use OnQ® elastomeric pump system . As double-blinded , randomize , placebo control study , woman undergo first , second third cesarean section randomly assign one 3 different group . Group 1 receive saline , group 2 give ropivacaine 0.1 % , group 3 give ropivacaine 0.2 % , rate 8ml/hr via OnQ® pump system . Each group also receive 8mL bolus previously assign infusate . The investigator ass pain rest movement different time period recovery process 3 month post operatively . The investigator also assess use system decrease need pain medication reduce potential side-effects pain treatment .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Female patient Emory University Hospital Midtown undergoing nonemergent , schedule unscheduled first , second third Cesarean section 2 . Patients American Society Anesthesiology ( ASA ) Class IIII 3 . Patients least 34 week pregnant 4 . Patients receive spinal anesthesia procedure 5 . Patients 18 year age old 6 . Patient willing able provide write informed consent 1 . Patients 3 prior Cesarean section 2 . Patients undergoing emergent cesarean section without general anesthesia 3 . Patients know allergy morphine , ketorolac , and/or amide local anesthetic 4 . Patients receive spinal anesthesia 5 . Patients less 34 week pregnant 6 . Patients significant maternal cardiac , liver renal disease 7 . Patients maternal history narcotic abuse dependency 8 . Patient preoperative fever ( > 100.4 degree F ) 9 . Patients le 18 year old
